WRITING.TEXT: That's pretty good advice tbh. Thank you.
Ill try this. Thank you.
24/7. Hahahahaha. I do have the grass crest shield on my back and havel's ring. I'll try patiently waiting for an opening though.
Patience, is maybe what I lack.
I'm currently using Ornstien's armor for the lightning defense. Maybe I'll switch to my +5 black iron armor .
I do stun him with my black knight halberd. But they very quickly gang up on me.

WRITING.TITLE: Tips For Soloing Ornstien Smough please.
WRITING.TEXT: I'm in NG+ right now. Level 105. I really want to solo them just for the personal satisfaction. I killed them last time with an overpowered pyromancer co-op, but this time I want to take them down solo. So what are your tips to git gud?

Start with dark souls 1 for sure. And classes don't really matter as you progress through the game and level up stats you like. One tip though. Don't level up resistance. It's useless. All the best and enjoy the journey.

Artorias. Fair fight. You have to be alert. Dodge well. Not get greedy. Heal at the right moments. All in all you have to really git gud to actually beat him. And soloing him with melle only is the best thing. You will die numerous times. But it is never frustrating.

From the bonfire room to the room with the hidden ladder behind the crates. Instead of taking the ladder go straight ahead. You'll find some rats. And there after the rats is a fog gate. Behind it is the channeler and his pet rats.
Ohh I run into a lot of action today. Got invaded about 5 times in 20 min.
I too, believe this strongly. Soul of Cinder was pretty much us from Dark Souls 1. Only difference that he had infinite stamina
He is pretty swole!
I must say Oolacile Royal Woods. Amazing rewarding experience. But that would only be after Anor Londo one obligatory area after that. But I am sure it will be amazing.
You sure miss the mechanics of dark souls and dread the combat of other games.
Align yourself and just do a normal roll. You'll be fine. Align yourself properly though and roll at the last possible moment.
I'm more of a no shield guy. Just use the grass crest on my back for the sweet stamina regen and two hand my +15 Zweihander. I love the pancakeing.
Thank you for the help.
Yes OS under 1300.
Nope. I already have a spare HD monitor.

WRITING.TITLE: First gaming PC
WRITING.TEXT: Hey guys! I'm about to build my first gaming PC in a month or so. My budget is approximately $1300. What are your recommended builds for 1080p gaming? Thanks for helping.
The Artorias boss fight has 2 bosses in total. Artorias himself and greed. The latter one being the one toughest to conquer.
You could well avoid everyone in the royal woods, if that helps.
Beating Artorias also was an epic moment for me besides reaching Anor Londo and stuff. The fight being so epic and fair, beating him I knew I fought well. I was shaking when I landed the last blow.
Yes. Already in Anor Londo now. :D
Your technique proved to be very very effective. Took her down finally. Thank you for the guide.
Will keep trying. Thank you!
Well yes she does keep Quelaag busy. But her explosive AoE attack one shots me even at 35 vitality. I'll keep trying though.

WRITING.TITLE: Help with Quelaag.
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey fellow undeads.. PC, currently i'm on NG+, SL 100. I'm having a tough time with Quelaag and mildred doesn't do much during the fight other than burn in lava.
Edit : Finished her.
A very nice read. Read all the NPC dialouges in their respective voices. :D
I am afraid you're late.

Mine was when I finally beat Knight Artorias. I died over 10 times to him. But dying never bothered me because the fight itself was such an amazing experience. When i finally beat him i was super proud as i knew i dodged well, attacked well. It's also my favorite boss fight in the entire game.
When I read the speculation of why he actually keeps invading the player I was crushed. A great man indeed.

For instance our character. First he/she has a purpose to ring the bells. Then, to reach Anor Londo and so on. This prevents him/her from going hollow. We get up from the bonfire and just get going. We can also presume a strong will power helps us stay just an undead. Conversely sometimes we give up on a character and start a new one. It is believed in the community that the abandoned character goes hollow in his world under such circumstances.
